category.description: Groups this package under 'Development Tools' in the documentation sidebar.

description.example: description: "A CLI tool for managing cloud resources."
description.description: Provides a brief description of the package.

enabled.description: Enables documentation generation for this package.

logos.description: Specifies additional logo files to include in the build output.

readme.description: Configures how the project's README.md is synchronized with documentation.

readme.base_url.description: Base URL used to convert relative paths to absolute URLs in the README.

readme.generate_toc.description: Automatically generates a table of contents in the README.

readme.logo.description: Configures automatic generation of a logo-with-text asset.

readme.output.description: Path where the generated README file will be written.

readme.source_section.description: Specifies which documentation section to inject into the README template.

readme.strip_lines.description: Removes the first 2 lines (often the title) from the source section before injection.

readme.template.description: Path to the template file used to generate the README.

sections.description: Defines the individual documentation sections to generate.

sections.binary.description: Name of the binary to execute for 'capture' type generation.

sections.descriptions.description: Path to a JSON file containing pre-generated descriptions for schema tables.

sections.output.description: Filename for the generated markdown output.

sections.prompt.description: Path to the prompt file used to instruct the LLM for this section.

sections.schemas.example:
schemas:
  - path: "core/config.json"
    title: "Core Settings"
  - path: "plugin/config.json"
    title: "Plugin Settings"
sections.schemas.description: Lists multiple schemas to aggregate into a single documentation page.

sections.source.description: Path to the source file (schema) or concept ID for generation.

sections.subcommand_order.description: Defines the display order of subcommands in the captured CLI reference.

sections.title.description: Title used in headers and navigation.

sections.type.description: Specifies the generation strategy (e.g., schema_to_md, capture, doc_sections).

settings.description: Configures global settings for the documentation generator.

settings.ecosystems.description: Lists the ecosystems to aggregate documentation from.

settings.model.description: Specifies the LLM model to use for generating documentation.

settings.output_dir.description: Sets the directory where generated markdown files will be saved.

settings.output_mode.description: Sets the output mode to 'package' (standard) or 'sections' (website content).

settings.regeneration_mode.description: Uses existing files as a reference when regenerating documentation.

settings.rules_file.description: Points to a custom .gitignore-style rules file for gathering context.

settings.structured_output_file.description: Outputs parsed documentation to a JSON file for programmatic use.

settings.system_prompt.description: Specifies a custom system prompt file to guide the LLM's style.

settings.temperature.description: Sets the randomness of the LLM generation (0.0 to 1.0).

settings.toc_depth.description: Limits the table of contents to 3 levels deep.

sidebar.description: Configures the website sidebar structure and ordering.

sidebar.categories.description: Customizes icons and layout for sidebar categories.

sidebar.packages.description: Customizes icons, colors, and status badges for packages in the sidebar.

title.description: Sets the title of the package documentation.
